data.description: Anthropic's Claude 3.7 Sonnet, a hybrid-reasoning model with 200k context; offers top-tier accuracy and supports vision input and file attachments.
Anthropic's Claude 3.7 Sonnet (Reasoning mode) with an extended 200k context; maximizes step-by-step reasoning and accepts images and file inputs.
Anthropic's Claude 3.5 Haiku model, a fast 200k-context assistant; supports vision and file inputs while delivering quick, reliable responses.
Anthropic's Claude 3.5 Sonnet with a 200k-token window, optimized for complex tasks; includes support for image understanding and file uploads.
Anthropic's Claude 3 Sonnet with a 200k-token context window; supports image inputs and file attachments for multimodal queries.
DeepSeek R1 reasoning model (open-source, ~70B params) with 128k context; excels at step-by-step logic and math. Text-only (no image or file input).
Cohere's Command R+ model (128k context) for robust instruction-following and retrieval-augmented tasks; text-only (no vision or file support).
DeepSeek R1 distilled variant (smaller dense model) offering efficient reasoning at lower cost. Text-only (no vision or file capabilities).
DeepSeek R1 served via FireWorks (128k context) – an open reasoning model comparable to top-tier closed models. No support for image or file input.
DeepSeek V3 (FireWorks hosted) – a 671B-parameter MoE chat model with 128k context for general-purpose Q&A. Text-only (no vision or file support).
DeepSeek V3 Turbo – a speed-optimized 64k-context version of DeepSeek V3 for faster responses. Text-only model without vision or file input support.
OpenAI's GPT-4o (omni) model with 128k context, multilingual and multimodal (text, image, audio) capabilities. Vision input is disabled here.
OpenAI GPT-4o with 128k context (same as GPT-4o base); high token capacity for long documents. Text-only usage (no file upload or image processing).
GPT-4o August snapshot – an updated version of GPT-4o with fresh training data (128k context). Provides multimodal reasoning (text-only in this context).
GPT-4o August edition with 128k context window. Capable of extended conversations and analysis. Vision/file features not enabled in this model context.
GPT-4o Mini – a smaller, cost-efficient variant of GPT-4o (128k context). Offers faster responses at lower cost. Text-only (no support for image/file input).
GPT-4o Mini with full 128k context support. Maintains cost-efficient operation for extended prompts. No vision or document-upload functionality.
Google's Gemini 1.5 Flash – a fast, multimodal-ready model with a 1M-token input window (8k output). High throughput for general tasks. (Text-only here; no file or image input.)
Gemini 1.5 Flash (128k context variant) – optimized for lengthy inputs (131k tokens). Fast and efficient for large text processing. No vision or file support in this mode.
Gemini 1.5 Flash + Search – an augmented version integrating retrieval capabilities. Provides quick answers using 1M-token context and search knowledge. (Text-only model.)
Google's Gemini 1.5 Pro – a larger multimodal model with 2M-token input capacity (8k output). Excels at complex reasoning and broad knowledge. (Vision features not available here.)
Gemini 1.5 Pro (128k context) – a high-capability model tuned for longer prompts (131k tokens). Ideal for in-depth analysis. Text-only usage (no image or file inputs).
Gemini 1.5 Pro + Search – combines the power of Gemini Pro with retrieval augmentation. Handles 2M-token context for knowledge-intensive queries. No built-in vision or file support.
Gemini 2.0 Flash – Google's latest fast, multimodal model (1M-token input, 8k output). Offers improved reasoning and native tool use. (Text output only; no direct image/file input here.)
Gemini 2.0 Flash-Lite – a lighter, cost-efficient version of Gemini 2.0 Flash with the same 1M context window. Suited for lower-latency tasks. Text-only (no vision or file handling).
Meta's Llama 3 (70B) optimized on Groq hardware for speed. Provides strong chat and reasoning capabilities on a standard 4k context. Text-only model (no image or file support).
Llama 3.1 405B Instruct (FireWorks) – an extremely large 405B-parameter Meta model with 128k context. Excels in complex understanding. Text-only (no vision/file inputs).
Llama 3.2 90B Vision (FireWorks) – Meta's 90B multimodal model with ~131k context support. Strong in both language and visual reasoning (vision disabled in this environment).
Llama 3.3 70B Instruct (FireWorks) – an improved 70B Meta model for text generation and reasoning, with enhanced performance over Llama 3.1. Supports text only (no image or file input).
Upstage Mistral Large 2 (22B+ params) – a high-performance single-GPU model for enterprise tasks. Default 4k context. Text generation only (no vision or file handling).
Mistral Large 2 with extended 128k context – handles very large inputs while maintaining strong single-GPU performance. Text-only model (no image or file support).
Mixtral 8×7B ensemble on Groq – a mixture of eight 7B Mistral models for enhanced output quality. 4k context per query. Text-only output (no support for vision or files).
Alibaba Qwen QwQ 32B (preview, turbo) – a 32k-context instruct model specialized for chat. Delivers strong multilingual answers. Text-only (no image or file inputs).
Alibaba Qwen2.5 72B Instruct – a 128k-context instruction-tuned model with state-of-the-art knowledge and coding ability. Text generation only (no vision or file input here).
Alibaba Qwen2.5 Coder 32B – a code-specialized 32B model (33k context) excelled in programming tasks. Cost-effective for coding assistance. No vision or file input support.
Upstage Solar Pro (22B, single GPU) – enterprise-optimized model with 32k context; excels at structured text and multilingual tasks. Text-only (no image or file capabilities).
OpenAI o3-mini – a cost-efficient reasoning model (released 2025) with 200k context. Optimized for STEM reasoning and coding. No built-in vision or file input support.
OpenAI o3-mini (High effort) – the o3-mini model running with extra thorough reasoning, using up to 200k context. Excels in complex problem solving. Text-only model (no vision/file).
